titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the C. D. Wright Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:19

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The C. D. Wright papers consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, and printed and other material relating chiefly to Wright's literary and professional activities. There is correspondence from writers, artists, literary scholars, family, and friends. Named correspondents include Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge, Forrest Gander, Peter Gizzi, W. S. Merwin, Michael Ondaatje, Keith and Rosmarie Waldrop, Marjorie Welish, and Elizabeth Willis, among others. The writings include drafts, proofs, and other material for several works dating from the 1990s onward. Works include: Tremble (1996), DeepStep Come Shining (1998), Steal Away (2002), One Big Step (2003), Cooling Time (2005), and Rising, Falling, Hovering (2008). Other materials found in the collection include: notebooks and research material; printed material, including clippings, publicity, reviews, and issues of journals; computer files, including drafts of writings and copies of email; audiovisual materials, including sound recordings and photographs; records of the journal Lost Roads; legal records, including contracts and permissions; and documentation relating to other literary and academic matters, such as awards, conferences and other events, and blurbs and recommendations.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase, 2007-2012. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 26-27, 32, and 56 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 55 (audiovisual material): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The C. D. Wright Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: C. D. Wright Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified according to month and year of acquisition.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
Former call numbers: Uncat MSS 939, Uncat MSS 981, Uncat MSS 1287, and Uncat MSS 1288.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: C. D. Wright (1949-)
bioghist.p: In addition to the Witter Bynner Prize and a Whiting Award, she has received fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Guggenheim Foundation, the Bunting Institute, and the Lannan Foundation. With her husband, poet Forrest Gander, she edits Lost Roads Publishers. Wright teaches at Brown University.
Biographical information taken from the Academy of American Poets, Biographies of American Poets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The C. D. Wright papers consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, and printed and other material relating chiefly to Wright's literary and professional activities. There is correspondence from writers, artists, literary scholars, family, and friends. Named correspondents in the Collection Contents list below include Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge, Forrest Gander, Peter Gizzi, W. S. Merwin, Michael Ondaatje, Keith and Rosmarie Waldrop, Marjorie Welish, and Elizabeth Willis, among others. The writings include drafts, proofs, and other material for several works dating from the 1990s onward. Works include: Tremble (1996), Deepstep Come Shining (1998), Steal Away (2002), One Big Step (2003), Cooling Time (2005), and Rising, Falling, Hovering (2008). Other materials found in the collection include: notebooks and research material; printed material, including clippings, publicity, reviews, and issues of journals; computer files, including drafts of writings and copies of email; audiovisual materials, including sound recordings and photographs; records of the journal Lost Roads; legal records, including contracts and permissions; and documentation relating to other literary and academic matters, such as awards, conferences and other events, and blurbs and recommendations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four groupings: I. January 2007 Acquisition. II. January 2007 Addition. III. August 2012 Acquisition. IV. October 2012 Acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boxes 26-27 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

Organized into eleven subgroupings: Correspondence with Writers, Artists; Correspondence with Writers, Other Artists, Some Students, Family, Friends; Correspondence, Students/Writers; Correspondence, Family, Friends (Memphis and Fayetteville), Some Writers, Artists; CD MSS B202 #13; Old Writing Matter; CD Files from File Cabinet; One Big Self, CD 2006; Mixed Office (Bran) Files; Notebooks; and Miscellaneous Papers.

The 2007 January acquisition contains correspondence, writings, notebooks, and printed and other materials, including computer files, relating chiefly to C. D. Wright's literary and professional activities.
Acquired by gift and purchase, 2007. For more information, see the appropriate curator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The January 2007 Addition consists of thirty-three notebooks dating from 1994 to 2006.
Purchased from Lame Duck Books on the Edwin J. Beinecke and Hilda Doolittle Fund book funds, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 32 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
The August 2012 acquisition contains additional correspondence, writings, printed materials, and personal papers relating chiefly to C. D. Wright's literary and professional activities.

did.unittitle: Selections of Selected Poems in Run Through Rock by C.D. Wright
Ringling Suite. Relief Prints and Poems.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 55 (audiovisual material): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 56 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

The October 2012 acquisition contains correspondence, writings, audiovisual materials (including sound recordings and photographs), printed material, computer files (including email), and other documents relating chiefly to C. D. Wright's literary and professional activities.
